titleStmt.title: The crafty maid of the west: or, The lusty brave miller of the western parts finely trapan'd. A merry new song to fit young-men and maids. Tune of, Packingtons Pound.
titleStmt.author: Wade, John, fl. 1660-1680.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for P. Brooksby at the Golden Ball in Py-corner.

notesStmt.note: Author, place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
First line of text: You millers, and taylors, & weavers each one.
In four columns; at head of columns 3-4: The second part, to the same tune.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
